metadata.synopsis: Confrontation with Eltan noble if Ravengard died and Florrick is dead or still in prison.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard and Counsellor Florrick;- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

0.speaker: Cordula Eltan
0.text: Wyll Ravengard - the stain of Baldur's Gate.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

129.speaker: Cordula Eltan
129.text: To think your father's blood flows through those damnable veins.

45.speaker: Wyll
45.text: Cordula Eltan? By the Nine Hells, what are you on about?
45.context: NodeContext: In both recognition and shock.

48.speaker: Cordula Eltan
48.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.

99.speaker: Cordula Eltan
99.text: How you mean to make the city bow to you and you alone.

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.

29.speaker: Wyll
29.text: Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do!

26.speaker: Wyll
26.text: She lied to you, Eltan. I did everything in my power to get my father to safety!

16.speaker: Cordula Eltan
16.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

109.speaker: Wyll
109.text: Eltan. Mizora is a devil; I am my father's son. Will you really trust her word over mine?

23.speaker: Wyll
23.text: Eltan. I am my father's son. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.

14.speaker: Wyll
14.text: Do you mean Ansur? He's naught but bones, Eltan. But his spirit has blessed me with power.

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: A wyrm? Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: It will be done. I will seek the wyrm. Together, we will strike down the Absolute.

55.speaker: Cordula Eltan
55.text: Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.

73.speaker: Cordula Eltan
73.text: You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *This woman is no stranger to you - Cordula Eltan, Baldur's Gate patriar and heir to the founder of the Flaming Fist.*

88.speaker: Cordula Eltan
88.text: I won't have the Hells' errand boy poison Baldur's Gate!

116.speaker: Wyll
116.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.

50.speaker: Wyll
50.text: I have saved countless lives. I am still the man you thought I was.

65.speaker: Cordula Eltan
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eltan pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

42.speaker: Wyll
42.text: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.

100.speaker: Wyll
100.text: Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do.

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: Mizora is a devil - she lied to you. I wanted to save my father, and she sabotaged me.

1.speaker: Cordula Eltan
1.text: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.

58.speaker: Cordula Eltan
58.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

39.speaker: Cordula Eltan
39.text: Wyll, there's something you should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.

13.speaker: Cordula Eltan
13.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but as usual he realised the danger before anyone else did.

123.speaker: Cordula Eltan
123.text: He understood that if the cult would be successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

33.speaker: Cordula Eltan
33.text: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the champion would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be you.

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

24.speaker: Cordula Eltan
24.text: A bronze dragon, to be precise. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

7.speaker: Cordula Eltan
7.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

22.speaker: Cordula Eltan
22.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

44.speaker: Cordula Eltan
44.text: Since then, the city faced countless threats, but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. Until now.

60.speaker: Cordula Eltan
60.text: This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - we need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.

72.speaker: Cordula Eltan
72.text: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

8.speaker: Cordula Eltan
8.text: Let it set the path before you.

43.speaker: Wyll
43.text: Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead, Eltan.

86.speaker: Cordula Eltan
86.text: Dead? So once more, fortune turns against us.

31.speaker: Cordula Eltan
31.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

38.speaker: Wyll
38.text: Do you mean Ansur? He's dead.

4.speaker: Cordula Eltan
4.text: I should go, gather allies. We'll join you in your hour of need.

124.speaker: Cordula Eltan
124.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

93.speaker: Cordula Eltan
93.text: May your father's courage be with you. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

111.speaker: Wyll
111.text: Your faith in me is well-founded. I will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

74.speaker: Cordula Eltan
74.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

87.speaker: Wyll
87.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

101.speaker: Cordula Eltan
101.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

68.speaker: Wyll
68.text: Let the dragon sleep. I'll deal with the Absolute on my own terms.

122.speaker: Cordula Eltan
122.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

17.speaker: Cordula Eltan
17.text: That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you're to bear his legacy, you must release the wyrm.

79.speaker: Cordula Eltan
79.text: Free the wyrm, let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. May Lady Tymora smile upon you.

120.speaker: Cordula Eltan
120.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.

125.speaker: Cordula Eltan
125.text: Find it, and let it set its path before you.

105.speaker: Wyll
105.text: A wyrm? Why is this the first I'm hearing about this?

67.speaker: Cordula Eltan
67.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. Each of them will soon be put to the test.

49.speaker: Wyll
49.text: The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.

46.speaker: Cordula Eltan
46.text: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.

5.speaker: Cordula Eltan
5.text: You killed the best of Baldur's Gate. May the Hells make you suffer.

20.speaker: Wyll
20.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

121.speaker: Narrator
121.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

119.speaker: Cordula Eltan
119.text: Some hero. The Blade of Frontiers, nothing but a cold-blooded killer. I will make him pay for his father's death.

56.speaker: Cordula Eltan
56.text: I will not play your mind games. To arms!

66.speaker: Wyll
66.text: Well played, Eltan. But you will not stand in my way - the city is mine by rights.
